questions.clue: Known for its famous Red Light District and coffee shops, this European capital is bustling at night.
This South American capital is renowned for its vibrant tango clubs and lively nightlife scene.
Famed for its epic DJ scene and beach clubs, this capital city of Spain's island region is a summer party destination.
This Asian capital has a thriving nightlife with options ranging from themed izakayas to high-tech nightclubs.
Known for its intense underground club scene and techno music, this German city is a night owl's paradise.
In Greek mythology, Pegasus is known as this type of winged animal.
Native to the Himalayas, this 'Abominable Snowman' is better known by this name.
In Japanese folklore, this shape-shifting fox is known for its multiple tails.
Described in ancient Greek mythology, this multi-headed serpent was slain by Hercules.
This type of dragon from Slavic mythology resides in the mountains and is often depicted as a fire-breathing serpent with three heads.
This device, popularized by Apple in 2007, revolutionized personal communication and technology convergence.
This social media platform, launched in 2004, changed the way people connect online and boasts billions of users.
First tested in 2012, these vehicles use sensors and software to navigate without human input.
This currency, invented in 2009 by an unknown person or group using the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto, was the first implementation of blockchain technology.
CRISPR-Cas9 technology, developed in the early 2010s, allows for precise editing of this biological molecule responsible for genetic information.
This English novelist created Mr. Darcy in her book 'Pride and Prejudice'.
Known for his tale of a sailor named Ishmael, this author penned 'Moby-Dick'.
She wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird', a novel that explores racial injustice in the Deep South.
This Russian author chronicled the fall of the Karamazov family in 'The Brothers Karamazov'.
In this dystopian novel, Aldous Huxley imagines a future world state with a caste system.
This equestrian sport, which involves horses dancing to music, has been part of the Olympics since 1912.
This sport, where athletes compete in both fencing and shooting, is part of the modern pentathlon.
You won't need snow or ice for this tropical Olympic sport that debuted in 1996 and is played with a ball over a net in sand.
Introduced in the 2000 Sydney Olympics, this water sport uses inflatable rafts and was not present in 2008.
Originally intended for members of women's guilds in 1908, this unusual sport involves players sliding stones on ice towards a target marked with a house.

final.clue: In 1925, Virginia Woolf published this novel, which explores the thoughts of its protagonist over a single day in London.
